title: Add the missing help messages for some switches
body:
Fixes [#9710 ](https://github.com/dotnet/msbuild/issues/9710)

### Context
Some of the supported command line switches are not mentioned in the help message

### Changes Made
List the relevant string resource ID in s_parameterlessSwitchesMap / s_parameterizedSwitchesMap. And iterate the resource ids in the ShowHelpMessage

### Testing
Before:
[msbuildBefore.txt](https://github.com/dotnet/msbuild/files/14850246/msbuildBefore.txt)

[dotnetmsbuildBefore.txt](https://github.com/dotnet/msbuild/files/14850249/dotnetmsbuildBefore.txt)

After:

[MSBuildAfter.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/15952485/MSBuildAfter.txt)

[netMSBuildAfter.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/15952473/netMSBuildAfter.txt)

### Notes

commit.message: Add the missing help messages for some switches
Merge branch 'main' of https://github.com/dotnet/msbuild into dev/jennybai/issue9710
Read help mesage from paramer map
Refactor the get resource Id methods
Update the gettargetresults comment and fix the typo error
Fix the typo error and remove unuseful resource id
Merge branch 'main' of https://github.com/dotnet/msbuild into dev/jennybai/issue9710
Remove the resouce id for waitfordebugger

nodes.body:
> Looks good.
> 
> I agree that `getTargetResult` should probably specify that the specified target will be executed.

Thanks, have updated the help message for this property.

> Thank you, I've left a few comments inline. For testing, can you please compare the help output before and after, and from both MSBuild.exe and dotnet build?

I upload the text based on test. There is a change in the order of the switches. Please have a look if that is acceptable. -help is earlier than other no parameters switches since the https://github.com/dotnet/msbuild/blob/563c7b091b63874dd7e343dc8742690174fe165d/src/MSBuild/CommandLineSwitches.cs#L204-L227
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/msbuild/assets/26814373/82a968c8-3167-4258-bb4b-b79f16a36fbf)
/azp run
Azure Pipelines successfully started running 1 pipeline(s).

There are conflicts since the new analyzer switch in the commit  https://github.com/dotnet/msbuild/commit/f744eb5b855c02c7a55490de6a16c688931fa618#diff-c0f68f9abf837e0ecb1e4de52b83e9e81d6934c5596bc213e4b1de45e591d7ce But there is no help message for this analyzer switch.  @JanKrivanek , Could you give more info about this switch?  Should we show the help message for this switch?

> There are conflicts since the new analyzer switch in the commit [f744eb5#diff-c0f68f9abf837e0ecb1e4de52b83e9e81d6934c5596bc213e4b1de45e591d7ce](https://github.com/dotnet/msbuild/commit/f744eb5b855c02c7a55490de6a16c688931fa618#diff-c0f68f9abf837e0ecb1e4de52b83e9e81d6934c5596bc213e4b1de45e591d7ce) But there is no help message for this analyzer switch. @JanKrivanek , Could you give more info about this switch? nodes.body: Where is this new string on Parameter(less/ized)SwitchInfo used?
It's used here https://github.com/dotnet/msbuild/blob/5089df85a739c170a6c3ab0493bd2c17b36d81d4/src/MSBuild/XMake.cs#L4476-L4485

That isn't what I meant. In ShowHelpMessage, it directly accesses various strings, but it doesn't do that by iterating through all ParameterlessSwitchInfo objects in s_parameterlessSwitchesMap and looking at their fourth parameter. Where do we use the fourth parameter passed into ParameterlessSwitchInfo?

All switches should be cross-checked against the help message strings to see what else is missing. So I think we list the relevant string resource ID in s_parameterlessSwitchesMap / s_parameterizedSwitchesMap and access the fourth help string in showHelpMessage
Don't document `-waitfordebugger`. Since it's not in release builds, customers can't use it.

To be fair, the corresponding `ParameterlessSwitchInfo` is ifdefed out in release builds so it will print only when running debug MSBuild. Still probably not worth keeping the resource string and localizing it.
removed the -waitfordebugger helpmessage
I feel like we need some organization here but we'll deal with that later. No action required now.
There are some switches using the same resource Id. So deal with duplicates here.  But thanks for your suggestions. Have refactored the code.
What's special about these switches? And if we don't want to return them, should we just remove them from the map?
sorry, forget the macro in the parameter map. This is not right. Have updated

```suggestion
    <value>  -terminalLoggerParameters:default=[auto|false|true]
```

That raises the question: do we doc `on` and `off` which IIRC were put in for compat against some bad early docs, or just `true` and `false`?

We should also mention that if nothing is specified that means `auto`

nodes.body:
updated as  -terminalLogger[:auto,on,off]
                     Users are able to opt-in and use the TerminalLogger.
                     Specify auto (or use the option without arguments) to
                     use the terminal logger only if the standard output
                     is not redirected.
                     EXCEPT when:
                     - The terminal does not support ANSI codes or color
                     - Output is redirected to a file or pipe
                     (Short form: -tl)

nodes.body: Are users ever expected to manage their own node pool directly like this? I can't think of a reason for them to do so. I'd be ok with hiding this from the user-facing help docs (though the in-repo/detailed developer docs should cover it).

nodes.body: I think what I meant was that there will be (already are?) other terminal-logger parameters besides `default`, like verbosity and probably other things in the future. So this will need to be organized like `HelpMessage_13_ConsoleLoggerParametersSwitch` where both the parameter names and the values can be documented.

nodes.body:
This seems not complete. This is what we support based on code:

https://github.com/dotnet/msbuild/blob/9ead13b2d7831878c684a2c3b24055d47d210e56/src/MSBuild/TerminalLogger/TerminalLogger.cs#L309-L318

in addition to 

https://github.com/dotnet/msbuild/blob/9ead13b2d7831878c684a2c3b24055d47d210e56/src/MSBuild/XMake.cs#L2826-L2827


So basicaly the parameters is a semicolon separated list - `par1;par2;par3...`, where each parameter is either in a form of `setting=value` or just `setting`

The settings currently can be:
* default - requires value
* v|verbosity - requires value
* ShowCommandline - just setting, value must not be specified

Please ping me once you have formulation of this section that incorporates the above and I'll have a look and signoff or object :)

+    <value>  -featureAvailability:featureName,...
+                     Check feature availability. The result is one of the
+                     strings "Undefined", "Available", "NotAvailable" and
+                     "Preview".
+                     - Undefined - the availability of the feature is undefined
+                     (the feature name is unknown to the feature availability
+                     checker)
+                     - NotAvailable - the feature is not available (unlike
+                     Undefined, the feature name is known to the feature
+                     availability checker and it knows the feature is not
+                     supported by current MSBuild engine)
+                     - Available - the feature is available
+                     - Preview - the feature is in preview (not stable)
+                     (Short form: -fa)
+    </value>
+    <comment>
+      LOCALIZATION: "-featureAvailability", "-fa", "Undefined", "Available" "NotAvailable" and "Preview"should not be localized.
+      LOCALIZATION: None of the lines should be longer than a standard width console window, eg 80 chars.
+    </comment>

+                     Enable or disable the terminal logger. Terminal logger
+                     provides enhanced build output on the console in real time,
+                     organized logically by project, and designed to highlight
+                     actionable information. Specify auto (or use the option
+                     without arguments) to use the terminal logger only if the
+                     standard output is not redirected. Don't parse the output
+                     or otherwise rely on it remaining unchanged in future
+                     versions. This option is available in MSBuild 17.8 and
+                     later.
+                     (Short form: -tl)
+    </value>
+    <comment>
+      LOCALIZATION: "-terminalLogger", "-tl", and "auto" should not be localized.
+      LOCALIZATION: None of the lines should be longer than a standard width console window, eg 80 chars.

+                     This writes the value of property Bar into Biz.txt.

+      LOCALIZATION: None of the lines should be longer than a standard width console window, eg 80 chars.
+    </comment>
+  </data>
+  <data name="HelpMessage_48_TerminalLoggerParametersSwitch" Visibility="Public">
+    <value>  -terminalLoggerParameters: <parameters>
+                      Parameters for the TerminalLogger. (Short form: -tlp)
+                      default parameter.
+                      - `on`, `true`  forces TerminalLogger to be used even when
+                      it would be disabled.
+                      - `off`, `false` forces TerminalLogger to not be used even
+                      when it would be enabled.
+                      - `auto` enables TerminalLogger when the terminal supports
+                      it and the session doesn't have redirected stdout/stderr
+

+                        -terminalLoggerParameters:default=auto

+      LOCALIZATION: None of the lines should be longer than a standard width console window, eg 80 chars.
+    </comment>
+  </data>
+  <data name="HelpMessage_46_FeatureAvailabilitySwitch" Visibility="Public">
+    <value>  -featureAvailability:featureName,...
+                     Check feature availability. The result is one of the
+                     strings "Undefined", "Available", "NotAvailable" and
+                     "Preview".
+                     - Undefined - the availability of the feature is undefined
+                     (the feature name is unknown to the feature availability
+                     checker)
+                     - NotAvailable - the feature is not available (unlike
+                     Undefined, the feature name is known to the feature
+                     availability checker and it knows the feature is not
+                     supported by current MSBuild engine)
+                     - Available - the feature is available
+                     - Preview - the feature is in preview (not stable)
+                     (Short form: -fa)
+    </value>
+    <comment>
+      LOCALIZATION: "-featureAvailability", "-fa", "Undefined", "Available" "NotAvailable" and "Preview"should not be localized.
+      LOCALIZATION: None of the lines should be longer than a standard width console window, eg 80 chars.
+    </comment>
+  </data>
+  <data name="HelpMessage_47_TerminalLoggerSwitch" Visibility="Public">
+    <value>  -terminalLogger[:auto,on,off]
+                     Enable or disable the terminal logger. Terminal logger
+                     provides enhanced build output on the console in real time,
+                     organized logically by project, and designed to highlight
+                     actionable information. Specify auto (or use the option
+                     without arguments) to use the terminal logger only if the
+                     standard output is not redirected. Don't parse the output
+                     or otherwise rely on it remaining unchanged in future
+                     versions. This option is available in MSBuild 17.8 and
+                     later.
+                     (Short form: -tl)
+    </value>
+    <comment>
+      LOCALIZATION: "-terminalLogger", "-tl", and "auto" should not be localized.
+      LOCALIZATION: None of the lines should be longer than a standard width console window, eg 80 chars.
+    </comment>
+  </data>
+  <data name="HelpMessage_51_GetResultOutputFileSwitch" Visibility="Public">
+    <value>  -getResultOutputFile:file
+                     Redirect output from get* into a file.
+
+                     Example:
+                     -getProperty:Bar -getResultOutputFile:Biz.txt
+                     This writes the value of property Bar into Biz.txt.
+    </value>
+    <comment>
+      LOCALIZATION: "-getResultOutputFile", "get*" and "-getProperty" should not be localized.
+      LOCALIZATION: None of the lines should be longer than a standard width console window, eg 80 chars.
+    </comment>
+  </data>
+  <data name="HelpMessage_48_TerminalLoggerParametersSwitch" Visibility="Public">
+    <value>  -terminalLoggerParameters: <parameters>
+                      Parameters for the TerminalLogger. (Short form: -tlp)
+                      default parameter.
+                      - `on`, `true`  forces TerminalLogger to be used even when
+                      it would be disabled.
+                      - `off`, `false` forces TerminalLogger to not be used even
+                      when it would be enabled.
+                      - `auto` enables TerminalLogger when the terminal supports
+                      it and the session doesn't have redirected stdout/stderr
+
+                      Example:
+                        -terminalLoggerParameters:default=auto
